runs.comm: full, wide and snaking away from the left-hander first ball, and Smith leaves well alone
on target this time, spearing the ball at off stump. Smith taps softly towards mid off and they set off - South Africa are up and running!
woah! Roach dug that in half way done and the ball really ballooned up, way way over Bosman's head and over the keeper too and away for byes. What's more, he overstepped so this'll be a free hit
slashed away over backward point, third man sprints in to cut it off and fires in a quick return
on a length on off stump, Bosman moves confidently forward to defend the ball to the off side with a resounding crack off the bat
full and squeezed out just to Pollard's right at point, they scamper two
slapped very hard behind square on the off side and Pollard dives to his right to pull off a great stop. Good, clean fielding effort there, saving four runs
edged! But it falls well short of Fletcher, who has now come up a couple of yards
there's some bounce! Smith is comprehensively beaten outside off stump by pace and bounce from Taylor
big shout! Smith walked down the pitch and the ball struck him on the pads, looked like a good shout but he's probably been saved by the fact he was well down the wicket
chopped down on the off side, they don't risk a sneaky single
short and wide from Taylor, but the wicket appears to be playing slow and the ball takes an age to get to Smith, who cuts hard down towards point
too full, pushed through the covers and they run two to spoil what would've been a maiden
full and swinging in a touch, defended on the off side
good pace from Roach, hurrying Bosman into the shot on the off side
sharp bouncer! Bosman just about swayed away in time, but that fairly whizzed past his helmet
back and across in defence
close! Chipped in the air by Bosman, towards midwicket but dropping just short of Benn. They steal a run while the return comes in

what's happened here? Taylor slammed one in back of a length, Bosman went to pull and appeared to glove it down the leg side, where Fletcher took a good, tumbling catch. The Umpire then signalled wide... but Bosman walks! Bizarre
shaping in to Kallis's legs, the batsman walks across and angles the ball fine down the leg side, they run a single
steepling bounce now from Taylor, and Smith plays the ball down awkwardly off his chin down towards third man
just a hint of an appeal from Taylor this time as the ball darts in to the batsman's pads, but he get's a little inside edge and the appeal is quickly quashed
slower bouncer from Taylor, and Kallis didn't pick that one at all. He was through with the shot before the ball had even got to him, and took a painful blow under the armpit
pushed defensively into the leg side, where midwicket sprints in to negate any thoughts of a single
he starts with a huge, looping full toss, but Smith can't capitalise on that. He slaps straight to mid off, and they sprint through for one
watchfully pushed into the covers by Kallis, no run
close! Kallis bent down to sweep, getting a top edge. Bravo sprinted back from square leg and leapt, full-length, but just couldn't get to it
Smith backs away to give himself room to cut, but is beaten by the bounce. The alarming bounce is fortunate, in the end, as the ball bounces over the stumps after beating the bat
slapped to point's left, where the fielder pulls off an athletic diving stop, but can't stop the run
down the wicket and smacked back to the bowler

Smith charges down the track and is undone by a slower cutter from Taylor. The ball bounced more than he expected and gripped a little on the surface, striking the arm or the body and trickling to the keeper's left
well, Smith didn't have to move his feet for that one. Low full toss from Taylor and Smith clipped it firmly to deep imidwicket. Sammy sprinted round the boundary but couldn't quite cut it off
Smith is finding some rhythm now! Crunched straight back over Taylor's head this time, authoritative shot there from the South African captain
another slower bouncer from Taylor, real tennis-ball bounce in this pitch but Smith rocks back to get on top of the ball, rolling his wrists over a pull to keep it down. They sprint one
Kallis makes some room, moving to leg and Taylor follows him, no run the result

runs this time! The South Africans are starting to become accustomed to the pace and bounce - or lack thereof - in this pitch. It was short again from Taylor, quicker this time, but Kallis was smoothly back in the crease to hammer a pull powerfully in the air towards wide long on
fired in to the pads, Smith gets across to work the ball to fine leg
Kallis gets low down to paddle sweep, and they sprint through for two as the fielder is a little slow to get round on the boundary. Benn gives him a little gee-up for his efforts
reverse sweep from Kallis this time, but he's missed it completely
gives himself some room this time and slashes wildly down to third man. That was a six-or-sticks shot, and they pick up two as he top edges
quick through the air from Benn, Kallis punches into the covers
and again, but this time he just about picked the gap - or at least didn't hit it straight to the fielder, and they scamper through for one
Kallis opens the face to send a length ball on off stump down to third man. Very little bounce on that one, really dying in the pitch
on the hips, and flicked out to deep square leg for one
now there's some bounce! Awkwardly played by Kallis, who had charged down the pitch and tried to flay the ball through the off side, but couldn't connect at all
back of a length again, Kallis drops the ball into the covers and they scramble one
ugly swipe across the line from Smith, but this time the ball has dribbled through very low and he misses completely. Sammy can see the funny side, but Smith is a little nonplussed

same shot from Smith, this time he's nailed it! Smeared across the line by the burly left-hander, and he's found the gap at wide long on to pick up four valuable runs on a wicket where runs have been hard to come by
speared in to the pads from round the wicket, Kallis sweeps hard, beating short fine leg, but the fielder on the square leg boundary comes round to keep them to two
slapped into the off side, no run
hammered! Kallis committed himself to the slog sweep and struck the ball sweetly off the middle of the bat to send it sailing over midwicket and into the crowd. Big shot!
slashed square, and they pick up one to the cover sweeper
same shot, different batsman, as Smith makes room to cut the ball hard out to the cover sweeper
very full and bunted down the ground by Kallis, they pick up one to long on
alarming, tennis-ball bounce there! Kallis recovered well though, swaying back and opening the face on the bat to send the ball up and over to third man
Smith clears the front leg and hoicks across the line, but can't quite get the timing so only one run is the result
that looked like the cutter from Sammy, Kallis kept his eye on it and pushed defensively to extra cover

again the ball bounces up alarmingly, and Kallis is completely undone by it this time! He veered out of the way of the ball, and somehow Fletcher got a glove to it, otherwise that would have been four byes.
Kallis pulls in the air, and the ball just clears the fielder! That was a real spliced shot, didn't go anywhere, but luckily for Kallis it beat the fielder
again Smith smears across the line, and picks up one to long on
and Smith greets him by dancing out to take a length ball on the half volley and swing it out behind square on the leg side. The ball slows up on the outfield though, so only two runs conceded
Smith backs away now, and Bravo pulls his length back. The batsman aims a meaty pull through the leg side, finds the fielder, but they sprint through all the same

well, Kallis had no trouble getting that one out the middle! The ball was full and he came forward and pushed wristily through the line to send the ball sailing away, with the wind, over deep midwicket. A superb shot on a difficult wicket
more runs, as Kallis clips onto the leg side, but the fielder cuts the shot off on the boundary and they run three
Smith backs away to leg and Bravo follows him, beating the bat but they run one as the ball bobbles down the leg side off the pad
not pretty from Bravo, big, big wide down the off side and Fletcher has done really well to cut that off while standing up to the stumps
back of a length, Kallis gives himself room to slash this one down to third man
smacked down to long on, and they amble through

Smith has his eye in now! Just a little floaty from Gayle, Smith went for a full-blooded slog sweep. The deep midwicket fielder was interested for a while, but the ball went miles over his head and into the crowd
again Smith tries to slog sweep, this time the ball comes off the inside edge and goes very fine on the leg side
ooh, chance for a run out there! They set off for a single but the ball had gone almost straight to Bravo, who fired in a throw at the stumps with Smith well short, but couldn't hit them!
Kallis backs away with Gayle coming round the wicket, pushing the ball out on the leg side. They decide against two
crunched down the ground to long on

Gone! Smith falls to Miller's first ball! He tried the reverse sweep, missed it and over-balanced and Fletcher whipped the bails off. But hang on, replays show that Smith's foot was still balanced when the bails came off. He's walked off though, so I suppose that's a wicket, and West Indies won't mind one little bit
pushed softly into the covers, no run
straighter this time from Miller, coming round the wicket, but de Villiers can't find placement on the leg side
nudged very fine on the leg side, Kallis calls him through for a sprinted single
chopped down fine on the off side as Kallis gives himself room
speared at the toes, de Villiers tries to paddle it fine but misses and is struck on the foot. Missing leg stump though, and no appeal at all
the ball spits up off a length, the batsman hangs back deep in the crease with the keeper up and plays it down just to short third man's left
back of a length from Pollard again, nudged down on the leg side and they sprint through
Kallis moves to leg, Pollard follows him but he goes through with the shot to send the ball out to deep square leg
big wide from Pollard, pushing the ball very wide of off stump
drop and run from de Villiers now, as the ball bobbles behind square and they sprint through
Kallis goes for the double-bluff, telegraphing a movement to leg and then shuffling to off, but Pollard doesn't fall for it and the subsequent drive into the covers is immediately cut off
pushed into the covers again, this time hit just softly enough that they have time to steal a run. Kallis keeps struck, and another run to the total
Kallis goes for a huge swipe to leg and meets nothing but fresh air. Miller is less than impressed
a less expansive sweep this time, and they pick up one to deep square leg
driven in the air inside-out over cover, the sweeper cleans up and they take one
there's a shot from Kallis! The ball was pitched up on off stump, he cleared the front leg and swung through the line, getting a good, clean connection to send the ball up and over long off
crunched down the ground, very straight but the long on fielder gets round in time to cut it off
pushed into the off side, they set off and make it, and that's fifty for Kallis! A really good effort on a pitch that looks difficult to survive on, let alone make runs
once again the ball leaps up off a length, Kallis taps back to the bowler
width given outside off stump, Kallis aims a mow over the covers and ends up sending the ball up off the top edge and down to third man
full, Kallis drives and inside-edges, they steal one to short fine leg
cutter from Pollard, de Villiers pulls off the front foot out to square leg

Kallis falls! Big, big wicket for West Indies, and Pollard is the man that has done it for them. The ball was back of a length and straight, Kallis tried to pull and presumably was aiming for a maximum, but he was hitting into the wind and didn't get a good connection. Sarwan ran in and held onto a regulation chance
well, not great follow-up to the wicket there. Massive wide down the off side
that's much better, a slower offcutter from Pollard. Though they've taken two from a solid punch to wide long on, the ball was full and aimed at the stumps
he's just erred in line to start with, sending a short ball just a touch too far down leg

what a comeback! They obviously had a plan to target Duminy's leg stump here, once again the ball was fired toward the leg stump from over the wicket, Duminy walked too far across in trying to work the ball to leg and his stumps went for a walk! West Indies celebrate, and that's another wicket at the wrong time for South Africa
sharp start to the new batsman, fast and on a length but he's back and across in solid defence

vicious pace and bounce off the pitch, and Botha has gloved one! That was a brute of a delivery, Both stuck his hand up in self-preservation as the ball spat up at him, the ball looped up off the glove and Fletcher scooted round to take an easy catch. Roach is on fire here, another wicket for West Indies!
much fuller this time, and chopped down to third man with minimal foot movement
Petersen is undone by some sharp pace and movement in from Roach, taking the ball on the thigh pad. They sprint through for one all the same
slapped out into the covers, and they charge through for two while the throw comes in. Almost overthrows there, not the greatest return to Fletcher
bouncer from Pollard, Petersen went to pull but is beaten by some extra bounce. That looked like it went over the batsman's head, but not given as a wide
angling in to the pads this time, and flicked to fine leg's right
pushed down the ground, and though de Villiers and Petersen are lightning-quick between the wickets they decide against two
full and at the toes, clipped in the air out to deep square leg
de Villiers backs away, giving himself acres of room, and Pollards floats up a slower one, beating the batsman's wild slash

another slower cutter, another wicket for Pollard! de Villiers was aiming straight down the ground, but sliced at the ball just a little, putting more height than distance in the shot, and long off barely had to move in taking the catch
spicy delivery, back of a length and up into the ribs, but McLaren gets across to drop it on the leg side and they scramble a run
crunched across the line by Petersen, who got a good connection but found the fielder with the shot
nice shot there! Petersen picked the length early, swivelling back to pull handsomely out to deep square leg. The placement and timing were perfect there, and four runs the result

well, another wicket! After all the criticism levelled at him, that's a smart piece of work from Fletcher. The ball was missed by the batsman and came through to him on the bounce, Petersen thought about stealing a bye but Fletcher threw down the stumps with a direct hit that found him well short
new batsman off the mark straight away with a tip-and-run to mid on
McLaren backs away to give himself room and carves the ball out into the off side, they sprint two on what is a fairly large ground
short and angled down to short third man. The fielder is there but they charge through regardless
McLaren goes for a massive swipe over the leg side but misses completely
and again! McLaren is aiming to send the ball into a low orbit here, but he can't lay bat on it
he goes down to sweep the cutter this time, and some really sharp running gets them two runs. They could've been in trouble there with a better throw, but at this stage you've got to just go for it
top-edged drive down the ground falls short of long off and they charge through

van der Merwe shapes to play some sort of bizarre reverse-pull, Pollard fires down a cutter back of a length and the batsman gets glove/splice on it. The ball loops up and over the keeper, and third man (or is that fine leg?) fumbles in the field to allow them back for two
